resources.string: Application ID

The appID used to identify the application to the data vault. If you are using SMP, this should be consistent with the appID of the target application. Note that this value is distinct from the packageName, which is mainly used to identify your application in app stores.
Fiori Server URL

The full URL of the target application. If your application does not use SMP, it will navigate directly to this URL once logon is completed. If your app does use SMP, this URL is parsed and used in the following way: 1. The URL scheme (which must be http or https) determines the inital value of the \'https\' flag in the registration dialog. Similarly, the host and port in the URL determine their corresponding initial values in the registration dialog, with port defaulting to 443 if it\'s not specified. 2. The URL suffix (everything after the host and port) is appended to the URL that the user registers to. Though this is likely to be the same as the scheme, host and port from 1., the user has the opportunity to change these values. In contrast, the suffix can\'t be changed. If you are using SMP, you will ultimately want to specify the scheme, host and port of your SMP server, followed by the suffix of the Fiori endpoint. For example:
\'https://my.smp.server:8081/sap/bc/ui5_ui5/ui2/ushell/shells/abap/FioriLaunchpad.html\'
Application Name
An optional property used to customize the Fiori application name shown on logon screen. By default, the app name is "SAP Fiori Client". When this field is blank the default is used.
Fiori Server URL is an SMP server
Set this to true if your are using SMP. If set to true, the application will perform SMP registration.
Prefetch web assets

Fetches web assets of SAP Fiori apps from Fiori Front End Server and downloads them to the user\'s device. After the initial download, fetches and downloads any application updates from Fiori Front End Server.
Client Certificate Provider
Client Certificate Provider
Automatically Select Client Certificate Provider
Automatically select the client certificate for mutual authentication if only one client certificate is available.
Communicator ID
The communicator id for SMP/HCPms registration. The default is "REST".
Afaria Certificate Provider Keysize
An optional argument for the AfariaCertificateProvider. It sets the bit rate of the public/private keys. If this value is empty, or invalid, it will default to 2048.
IDP Logon URL
URL used to reload idp logon with username/passcode passed from SAP authenticator for SSO.
Enable Cache Manager
Enables the Cache Manager plugin.
Allow Saving Form Credentials
Allow form credentials to be saved and pre-populated in the future.
Disable Passcode Screen
When true, the passcode screen will not be shown. Must be false when multi-user support is enabled.
Passcode Policy Expiration Days
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Has Digits
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Has Lower Case Letters
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Has Special Letters
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Has Upper Case Letters
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Default Allowed
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Lock Timeout
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Minimum Length
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Minimun Unique Chars
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Retry Limit
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Passcode Policy Allow Fingerprint Authentication
The passcodePolicy of the data vault. Note: if you are using SMP, the passcodePolicy is determined by the server.
Authorization Type
The authorization type. This only needs to be specified for OAuth (as "oauth2") or SAML (as "saml2.web.post").
OAuth Authorization Endpoint
The URL used to authorize the user.
OAuth Token Endpoint
The URL to get the tokens from.
OAuth Grant Type
The grant type to use.
OAuth Client ID
The client ID that will be used to identify the application.
